channel.title: Reforming [C]
channel.description:
Since the beginning of [C], griefing has been an issue. This is simply because blocks and break instantly and any user has access to lava. Along with a number of other users, I believe [C] requires some sort of whitelist. This could be anything from a simple application to a required in-game playtime. I don't imagine a griefer would sit on a server for 24 hours straight just to grief it. As a result of the free and open policy of [C], this is the damage that was caused.
As a result of this chaos, I am requesting that the world be rolled back anywhere from 48-72 hours, whatever will fix the damage.
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/116q4qu.png[/img] [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/21btdhy.png[/img] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/2eog0th.png[/img] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/349bdvr.png[/img] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/33dgnpg.png[/img] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/nn1f1v.png[/img] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/35lb18n.png[/img] [IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/334jfq1.png[/img] [IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/2mmvkmg.png[/img] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/24glndf.png[/img]

<.>,<.>[/quote]

I do agree 1 week is too much, we have to be careful though considering some people have played a short while and then done damage to [C]. So let’s not be too easy on this either.

item.title: Reforming [C]
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:19, topic:440648”]We’re talking about 1 week ingame time, which is different from forum time in many ways. Though what I stated was just an example - so obviously its up for discussion.

I’ll make it.

<.>,<.>[/quote]

its alot easier to get 1 week online forum time. so with that being said, i still don’t think i have a week of gameplay on the server.

to mopar, is your script going to tally them up as a total? or are you going to have to have a specific amount of specific things?

I think it would be a good idea to have it total, but someone chatting would be easy to bypass when no one is on the server. Unless you add a timer so people couldn’t spam.

Read full topic

item.title: Reforming [C]
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:18, topic:440648”][quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=543327.msg3984469#msg3984469 date=1335718331]

1 week online time is a lot

my current online time for mopar is

Total time logged in: 37 days, 22 hours and 34 minutes

this is added up from my time online all the way to 2008, and this is only like 5 weeks

the week timer should be how old their registration is

how about just make the whitelist anyone who is on the tnt whitelist?
[/quote]\

im against a manual whitelist for [c][/quote]

Actually this is going to be fully automatic too, now that we have the new version of xAuth which enables that.

But those requirements are a little too strict I think. So anyone with TNT access should be able to build in creative, but others should be able to as well.

My script also counts things like the number of times someone chatted, the number of times someone else chatted about them, number of PMs, etc etc. We can take any or a combination of them into account.

Read full topic

item.title: Reforming [C]
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I do agree something needs doing, though lets just sum up some of the ideas that have been put forward:

[ul][li]X amount of logins before you’re allowed to access the C world. - This on its own wouldn’t be very effective as I could simply log in/out many times to achieve the given number, which a few people would probably do.[/li][/ul]

[ul][li]Manual whitelist - “Manual” says it all really, slow and inefficient, and how would we know who to trust anyhow, we may as well make it automatic.[/li][/ul]

So, we must merge them, a whitelist (which is automatic). based on: online time, and amount of logs. For example:

1 week online time, 30 /logins

The /logins are there to ensure they don’t just login and stand there, as rare and improbable as it is it makes me feel better about it

Now one issue remains, who’s going to make it, in reality, nobody is. So the above requirments with a combination of ideas should be acceptable for a manual whitelist

Read full topic
